quote: A hallucination is a fact, not an error; what is erroneous is a judgment based upon it.
A hasty judgment is a first step to recantation.
A man's conscience and his judgment is the same thing; and as the judgment, so also the conscience, may be erroneous.
A negative judgment gives you more satisfaction than praise, provided it smacks of jealousy.
About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
A hallucination is a fact, not an error; what is erroneous is a judgment based upon it.
A hasty judgment is a first step to recantation.
A man's conscience and his judgment is the same thing; and as the judgment, so also the conscience, may be erroneous.
A negative judgment gives you more satisfaction than praise, provided it smacks of jealousy.
About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
An artist is born kneeling; he fights to stand. A critic, by nature of the judgment seat, is born sitting.
Art is long, life short, judgment difficult, opportunity transient.
At twenty years of age the will reigns; at thirty, the wit; and at forty, the judgment.
Common sense is judgment without reflection, shared by an entire class, an entire nation, or the entire human race.
Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgment that something else is more important than fear.
Everyone complains of the badness of his memory, but nobody of his judgment.
Experts often possess more data than judgment.
Failure is simply a few errors in judgment, repeated every day.
Fortune truly helps those who are of good judgment.
Give every man your ear, but few thy voice. Take each man's censure, but reserve thy judgment.
Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
Good judgment comes from experience, and often experience comes from bad judgment.
Hesitancy in judgment is the only true mark of the thinker.
I'm convinced that what kids need today are parents - not buddies. They need someone who will exercise mature judgment.
If you get all the facts, your judgment can be right; if you don't get all the facts, it can't be right.
If you sit in judgment, investigate, if you sit in supreme power, sit in command.
In the lack of judgment great harm arises, but one vote cast can set right a house.
In the last analysis sound judgment will prevail.
Invention is the talent of youth, as judgment is of age.
It may be you fear more to deliver judgment upon me than I fear judgment.
Judicial judgment must take deep account of the day before yesterday in order that yesterday may not paralyze today.
Knowledge is the treasure, but judgment is the treasurer of the one who is wise.
Less judgment than wit is more sail than ballast.
Life is short, the art long, opportunity fleeting, experiment treacherous, judgment difficult.
Listening to both sides does not necessarily bring about a correct judgment.
Men of ill judgment ignore the good that lies within their hands, till they have lost it.
My salad days, when I was green in judgment.
Never a sound judgment without charity.
Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment.
Nor is the people's judgment always true: the most may err as grossly as the few.
One cool judgment is worth a thousand hasty counsels. The thing to do is to supply light and not heat.
Our duty is to believe that for which we have sufficient evidence, and to suspend our judgment when we have not.
Outward judgment often fails, inward judgment never.
People with bad consciences always fear the judgment of children.
Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgment of others.
Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgment of others.
Reason and judgment are the qualities of a leader.
Statistics are no substitute for judgment.
Take each man's censure, but reserve thy judgment.
The average man's judgment is so poor, he runs a risk every time he uses it.
The most terrible thing is your own judgment.
The secret of all good writing is sound judgment.
The senses do not deceive us, but the judgment does.
There's no need to hang about waiting for the last judgment. It takes place every day.
Thy books should, like thy friends, not many be, yet such wherein men may thy judgment see.
To sit alone with my conscience will be judgment enough for me.
True scholarship consists in knowing not what things exist, but what they mean; it is not memory but judgment.
We hold the view that the people make the best judgment in the long run.
Women excel more in literary judgment than in literary production, they are better critics than authors.
You can't depend on your judgment when your imagination is out of focus.
